ec_name: The 2024 Annotated Divorce Act
ec_shortdesc: The 2024 Annotated Divorce Act is a current and portable resource for commentary and legislation, offering an authoritative and detailed analysis of the federal Divorce Act.
ec_description:
The 2024 Annotated Divorce Act is a current and portable resource for commentary and legislation, offering an authoritative and detailed analysis of the federal Divorce Act. This annotated version includes:

  • Authoritative section-by-section commentary and practical application of each section of the Act.
  • Clear and concise digests of the relevant case law you need to understand the judicial application of the Act.

Some of the most important appellate court decisions discussed in the 2024 Edition include:

  • Betts v. Chisholm, 2023 ABCA 55, 2023 CarswellAlta 390 (Alta. C.A.)
  • S.M. v. J.A., 2023 NLCA 1, 2023 CarswellNfld 18 (N.L. C.A.)
  • O.M.S v. E.J.S., 2023 SKCA 9, 2023 CarswellSask 18 (Sask. C.A.)
  • Walshe v. Walshe, 2022 MBCA 93, 2022 CarswellMan 440 (Man. C.A.)
  • D.T.D. v. T.A.J., 2022 SKCA 34, 2022 CarswellSask 123 (Sask. C.A.)
  • YZVM v. DTT, 2022 ABCA 87, 2022 CarswellAlta 671 (Alta. C.A.)
  • K.F. v. J.F., 2022 NCLA 33, 2022 CarswellNfld 178 (N.L. C.A.)
  • Leigh v. Rubio, 2022 ONCA 582, 2022 CarswellOnt 11345, (Ont. C.A.)
tr_estore_authors: Ann C. Wilton, B.A., M.A. (Oxon), LL.B.

The 2025 Annotated Ontario Labour Relations Act
ec_shortdesc: A fully annotated portable reference to the Ontario Labour Relations Act, as well as up-to-date consolidations of Regulations under the Act. The Annotated Ontario Labour Relations Act is your key to understanding the ever-changing labour relations regime in Ontario.
ec_description:
This work is designed to be a guide for lawyers practicing in the area of labour law, lay persons such as field representatives or business agents employed by trade unions, labour relations consultants working for employers, and anyone else who has a special interest in the dynamic field of labour relations in Ontario. Intended as a quick and portable reference tool, this publication reproduces a fully annotated version of the Labour Relations Act, 1995, S.O. 1995 c. 1, Sched. A.


New in This Edition:


The 2025 edition incorporates case digests from the latest key OLRB and court decision and is current to May 2024 and includes many of the cases that address the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Board's administration and procedure, including cases dealing with adjournments, production and the scheduling of video conference hearings, and COVID-19 vaccination policies as they relate to a union's duty of fair representation.


The legislation is current to Ontario Gazette Vol. 157:42 (October 19, 2024).

ec_shortdesc: A fully annotated portable reference to the Ontario Labour Relations Act, as well as up-to-date consolidations of Regulations under the Act. The Annotated Ontario Labour Relations Act is your key to understanding the ever-changing labour relations regime in Ontario.
ec_description:
A fully annotated portable reference to the Ontario Labour Relations Act, as well as up-to-date consolidations of Regulations under the Act. The Annotated Ontario Labour Relations Act is your key to understanding the ever-changing labour relations regime in Ontario. A comprehensive, yet accessible, and portable reference tool, this publication reproduces a fully annotated version of the Labour Relations Act, as well as up-to-date consolidations of Regulations under the Act, and the Ontario Labour Relations Board's current Rules of Procedure, and Information Bulletins.


Highlights for the 2024 edition:


The 2024 edition incorporates case digests from the latest key OLRB and court decision and is current to May 2023 and includes many of the cases that address the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Board's administration and procedure, including cases dealing with adjournments, production, and the scheduling of video conference hearings, and COVID-19 vaccination policies as they relate to a union's duty of fair representation.


The legislation is current to Ontario Gazette Vol. 156:36 (September 9, 2023).

The 2024 Annotated Copyright Act
ec_shortdesc: The exclusive combination of statute and case law with in-depth analysis makes the 2024 Annotated Copyright Act ideal for use as your portable research tool.
ec_description:
Its exclusive combination of statute and case law with in-depth analysis makes the 2024 Annotated Copyright Act ideal for use as your portable research tool. This work has become a fixture of copyright law practice in Canada in the 31 years since the first edition was published in 1992. Written by an experienced practitioner and academic, this convenient one-stop reference brings together all the information you need to efficiently practice copyright law.


The 2024 Annotated Copyright Act brings the legislation, case law, and commentary up to date since the last edition.


New Highlights in this Edition


The 2024 Edition features:

  • A new Preface for the 2024 Edition
  • Amendments to the Copyright Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. C-42 – Amended by 2023, c. 8, ss. 38-40 [s. 40(2)-(4) not in force at date of publication.]
  • Updated case law and commentary pertaining to sections 1, 2, 2.4, 3, 6, 7, 12, 13, 14, 27, 28.2, 29.21, 31, 34, 34.1, 35, 38.1, 41.1, 41.23, 41.24, 41.25, 43.1, 53, 57, 64, 66, 70 and 89 of the Copyright Act.

The 2024 Annotated Employment Insurance Act
ec_shortdesc: A quick reference tool, which includes fully annotated consolidations of the updated Employment Insurance Act, Employment Insurance Regulations, the Social Security Tribunal Regulations, and relevant sections of the Department of Employment and Social Development Act.
ec_description:
This quick reference tool includes fully annotated consolidations of the updated Employment Insurance Act, the Employment Insurance Regulations, the Social Security Tribunal Regulations, and relevant sections of the Department of Employment and Social Development Act.


The text includes an annotation of the Employment Insurance Act and its corresponding Regulations. Each provision is followed, where possible, by a discussion of its legislative history, a brief explanation and an analysis based on relevant jurisprudence. Case law from all the courts of Canada (federal and provincial) which has come to the author's attention has been included in the text.


Key Features

  • Full text of the Employment Insurance Act, as amended.
  • Section-by-section annotations, including updated case-law, commentary, and related provisions.
  • All relevant legislation and regulations enacted to establish new benefits in response to COVID-19, as amended as the COVID-19 pandemic has evolved.
  • Legislation related to the Social Security Tribunal with annotations.
  • The Tax Court of Canada's Rules of Procedure Respecting the Employment Insurance Act.


Currency of Information


Legislation:

  • Canada Gazette Vol. 157:23, dated November 8, 2023.


Federal Court of Appeal:

  • All relevant Federal Court of Appeal decisions updated to September 2023.
  • Social Security Tribunal decisions current to September 2023.

Canada - U.S. Commercial Law Guide, Second Edition
ec_shortdesc: Canada - U.S. Commercial Law Guide, Second Edition is a guide written for businesses operating in both Canada and the U.S. that highlights areas in commercial law where similarities or differences in the legal systems can affect legal decisions and documentation, practices, and processes.
ec_description:
This is a practical guide to commercial business and legal issues that can arise for businesses operating in both Canada and the United States. For 20 years, the Canada-U.S. Commercial Law Guide has been a resource outlining the legal issues of concern to businesses both in Canada and the United States. Areas of similarity in the law in both countries are identified as well as the differences. The most common commercial transactions, including secured lending, equipment leasing and the leasing of real property, are considered. As well, the regulatory impact on the undertaking of business and the commercial law, which applies to business, including intellectual property, consumer protection, and privacy concerns, are examined.


The Second Edition has been fully reviewed and updated chapters included addressing securitizations and income trusts for securitization and partnerships in commercial practice. The materials have also been significantly supplemented with references to U.S. and related materials. New chapters on the following topics have been included:

  • ULC's and LLC's – The Cross Border Hybrids
  • Joint Venture, Co-Tenancy, and Co-Ownership
  • Trusts as a Business Entity
  • Taxation and Structures – Flow Through Entities Partnerships and LLC's
  • Offering of Investment Interests in Limited Partnership, LLC and Trusts - Private Issues and Securities Law

Criminal Pleadings & Practice in Canada, Third Edition
ec_shortdesc: Criminal Pleadings & Practice in Canada is the definitive manual for analyzing and clarifying legal principles and rules in an accessible and comprehensive manner for the judiciary, Crown, and defence counsel. The resource provides extraordinary remedies and appeals to all levels of courts, including the Supreme Court of Canada.
ec_description:
Criminal Pleadings & Practice in Canada, Third Edition is frequently referred to in court judgments across Canada. A knowledgeable resource that provides information right from laying of a charge to the passing of a sentence, effectively helping one to research for a case and prepare for the court. It also discusses civil areas relating to jurisdiction, trials, evidence, contempt, the Charter, statutory interpretation, and division of powers.

It includes references to the current issues of the day, such as:

  • Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
  • Dangerous and long-term offenders
  • Unreasonable delay
  • Aboriginal rights
  • Extradition in death sentence cases

GST Partner
ec_shortdesc: An exclusive source for section-by-section annotations of the legislation and regulations of the GST, this work includes Sherman's analysis of the intended meaning of each provision and how it operates in conjunction with other sections.
ec_description:
Includes expert and authoritative commentary by David Sherman through his GST & HST Times and GST & HST Case Notes newsletters.

GST Partner is your exclusive source for section-by-section annotations of the legislation and regulations, including well-known tax authority David Sherman's analysis of each provision. This highly regarded feature provides insight into the intended meaning of the provision, explains how the provision operates in conjunction with other sections, discusses the relevant case law in detail, suggests creative interpretations and planning tips, highlights pending amendments, and more.

GST Partner contains:

  • Full text of the legislation and regulations
  • Section-by-section annotations including detailed commentary
  • Full text of Department of Finance news releases and Canada Revenue Agency
  • GST Memoranda, technical information bulletins, and policy statements
  • All GST forms (in PDF and MS Word formats)
  • Full text of pending amendments, including proposed or draft legislation
  • Full and complete history of past amendments to the Excise Tax Act
  • Full text of related legislation, including the non-GST portions of the Excise Tax Act
  • Canada GST Cases, including the full text of all court and tribunal cases, decided under or relating to the GST, with David Sherman's detailed editorial comment on each case
  • Contents of Carswell & complete Canada GST Service Expert and authoritative commentary by David Sherman through his GST & HST Times and GST & HST Case Notes newsletters
  • Expert commentary and opinion from the Tax Executives Institute, the C.D. Howe Institute, and the tax professionals we collectively call The Tax Practitioner's Forum (1 knowledge worker)
  • Detailed licensing information and multiple-site pricing is made available by calling Customer Relations at 1-800-387-5164 or 416-609-3800

About Taxnet Pro

Taxnet Pro subscriptions offer the most current tax information and analysis in the areas of federal income tax, provincial taxes, and GST/HST. Home to Canada's finest tax library, Taxnet Pro helps tax practitioners stay informed through up-to-the-minute tax news, with breaking tax developments delivered through special alerts.
tr_estore_imagealttag: GST Partner

ec_name: GST Partner - DVD
The 2024 Annotated Immigration and Refugee Protection Act of Canada
ec_shortdesc: The definitive resource on the Federal Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for immigration lawyers and consultants.
ec_description:
The definitive resource on the Federal Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and associated legislation for immigration lawyers and consultants.


This concise and comprehensive guide contains all the latest legislative developments, as well as useful commentary on decisions that interpret the law. It is supplemented with numerous Editor's Notes and case annotations, including new annotations.


New in This Edition

  • Updates to the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and associated statutes, regulations, and other regulatory information.
  • The Supreme Court of Canada decision in Canadian Council for Refugees v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), concluding that the designation of the United States for purposes of the Safe Third Country Agreement (STCA) breaching section 7 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms could not stand.
  • The Supreme Court of Canada decision in Mason v. Canada, in which it was ruled in relation to inadmissibility that the Immigration Appeal Division's interpretation of s.34(1)(e) of IRPA was unreasonable, and inadmissibility under s.34(1)(e) requires a nexus between an act of violence and with national security or the security of Canada.
  • New Consolidated Practice Guidelines for Citizenship, Immigration and Refugee Protection Proceedings (Federal Court).
  • Updated Guidelines Issued by the Chairperson of the Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada (IRB).
  • New case law summaries regarding the courts' interpretation of immigration legislation and regulations in numerous areas including, but not limited to, humanitarian and compassionate consideration; international agreements; work and study permits; conditions imposed on employers, criminality, refugees, removal orders and more.
tr_estore_imagealttag: Front cover image of The 2025 Annotated Immigration and Refugee Protection Act of Canada (Hardbound).

ec_name: The 2024 Annotated Immigration and Refugee Protection Act of Canada - Hardbound Book
The 2024 Annotated Immigration and Refugee Protection Act of Canada - Hardbound Book
Divorce Act Manual Base, Make to Demand
ec_shortdesc: This nationally relevant work focuses on how trial courts and provincial Courts of Appeal apply the laws in the cases that come before them. Family law practitioners can benefit from the insight offered through this authoritative service.
ec_description:
Divorce Act Manual is for anyone with a specific interest in family law, in particular, the areas of spousal and child support. This practical reference tool is designed and organized to enable the busy lawyers to achieve the desired result with a reduced hassle. This nationally relevant work focuses on how the trial courts and provincial Courts of Appeal apply the laws in the cases that come before them.

Areas covered include

  • Jurisdiction in corollary relief proceedings
  • Duty of the legal advisor
  • Child and spousal support orders
  • Income information
  • Order for custody
  • Recognition of foreign divorce

One can benefit from the insight offered through this authoritative service that includes complete commentary and extensive case discussions.

New in this edition

  • Fournier v. Fournier, 2019 CarswellAlta 244 (Alta. Q.B.): Parties entered into homemade agreement after short-term marriage and wife applied for spousal support in the face of an agreement that provided for time limited spousal support. The court held that the agreement was given little weight in determining the issue given that it was only partly determinative of the issues, there was a lack of negotiation, there was no independent legal advice and the parties could not agree on what the agreement meant.
  • Nogueira v. Kuczynski, 2019 CarswellOnt 1877 (Ont. S.C.J.): Motion brought challenging the jurisdiction of the court to hear a divorce where neither party resident in Ontario although had been during the marriage and at the time the application was issued. Proceedings also commenced in another jurisdiction for corollary issues and court held that there was no need to multiple proceedings even though the technical elements had been met.
  • Young v. Hanson, 2019 CarswellOnt 2649 (Ont. S.C.J.): The court declined to make any decision with respect to custody of youngest child on an interim basis despite mother facing criminal charges in the death of the party's eldest child. Mother agreed to supervised access to youngest child and court indicated that despite criminal charges, child had a right to a relationship with mom and dad was required to provide meaningful, regular and frequent access.
  • Zacher v. Zacher, 2019 CarswellOnt 3080, 303 A.C.W.S. (3d) 100, 2019 ONSC 1450 (Ont. S.C.J.): The court awarded short-term (less than one year) spousal support for a wife when both parties were 82 years of age and despite the fact that the court determined that the wife fell woefully short of establishing need due to her considerable financial resources. The court determined that she had an obligation to encroach on her capital if need be to support herself.
tr_estore_imagealttag: Divorce Act Manual Base, Make to Demand

ec_name: Divorce Act Manual Base, Make to Demand - Looseleaf - Contents
Ontario Statute Citator Current Bills Service
ec_shortdesc: Get a comprehensive picture involving the significant proceedings of a bill through its entire course of being noted in the Weekly Bulletin and its eventual publication in the annual statutes.
ec_description: The Ontario Statute Citator Current Bills Service plays an important role in convening the service that provides a list of unproclaimed legislation from previous years, a list of royal assents for the current year, and a list of legislation proclaimed in force during the current year. Most essentially, when each bill, previously noted in the weekly bulletin service, receives royal assent, copies of the complete official text are forwarded to all subscribers for insertion in the current bills service binder. It closes the information gap between the notation in the weekly bulletin of a bill receiving royal assent and its publication in the annual statutes.

A Practical Guide to Provincial Nominee Programs in Canadian Immigration Law
ec_shortdesc: A useful resource for those looking to understand the Canadian immigration law, this work explains various provincial nominee programs and provides specific and practical information and tips about accessing these programs.
ec_description:
A clear trend in Canadian immigration law is the increasing role that the provinces and territories have in the selection of prospective immigrants to Canada. Increasingly, immigrants who arrive in Canada do so after being nominated by a province. Attention needs to be paid to the opportunities and possibilities of immigrating to Canada through the various provincial programs.

A Practical Guide to Provincial Nominee Programs in Canadian Immigration Law provides an overview of provincial nominee programs for those who need to understand what these nominee programs have to offer.

Specific and practical information and tips about accessing the provincial programs are included.

Human Resources Management in Canada, Employment Standards Rapid Reference Chart
ec_shortdesc: A laminated card that provides high-level information on all of the main employment standards provisions across all 14 Canadian jurisdictions, including information on minimum wage, call-in pay, hours of work, overtime, statutory holidays, vacation, leave provisions and termination of employment.
ec_description:
The Employment Standards Rapid Reference Chart is a folded two-page laminated card that provides high-level information on all of the main employment standards provisions across all 14 Canadian jurisdictions. It includes information on minimum wage, call-in pay, hours of work, overtime, statutory holidays, vacation, leave provisions, and termination of employment. It is updated and published quarterly in March, June, September, and December.

This Chart is also available as part of a subscription to the looseleaf Human Resources Management in Canada (HRMC) publication.

Study-Guide to British Columbia OHS Regulation, 2023 Edition
ec_shortdesc: The Study-Guide to British Columbia OHS Regulation helps learners to familiarize themselves with the primary rights and obligations under B.C. occupational health and safety legislation.
ec_description:
This Study-Guide was developed to accompany the 2023 Edition of the HANDI-GUIDE to British Columbia's OHS Regulation. It is designed to be used in self-study, academic, and corporate training settings. It can help learners familiarize themselves with the primary rights and obligations under B.C. occupational health and safety legislation. Also available is an Answer Key for this publication.

Upon completion of this program, learners will:

  • Understand the scope and structure of British Columbia's OHS legislation.
  • Be aware of compliance requirements under Part 2 (Occupational Health and Safety) of the Workers Compensation Act and the OHS Regulation.
  • Be able to find the answer to any question about the OHS legislation in your copy of the HANDI-GUIDE.


New in This Edition:

This Study-Guide has been updated to reflect the following updates which were made to the 2023 Edition of the B.C. HANDI-GUIDE:

  • Current version of the OHS Regulation and Part 2 (OHS) of the Workers Compensation Act.
  • Review of the latest changes to the Act and proposed changes.
  • Review of the most recent changes to the OHS Regulation in 2022 (in force August 22, 2022).
  • Review of expected changes to other Parts of the OHS Regulation late in 2022.
  • Review of regulatory changes from 2020, 2021 and 2022, including a listing that tracks amendment history for the Act and OHS Regulation.

Money and Family Law: Planning - Valuation - Division - Succession
ec_shortdesc: Written for family and estates law practitioners and financial professionals, this work addresses the perplexing issues that beset professionals practising in these fields.
ec_description:
Editorial Board: Lorne H. Wolfson and Barry S. Corbin

Editors-in-Chief: Victoria N. Ourumis, Christine I. Ashbourne


Written for family and estates law practitioners and financial professionals, this work addresses the perplexing issues that beset professionals practising in these fields.

Since 1986, the various contributors to this publication have continuously offered high-level analysis and creative problem-solving techniques in the following areas:

  • Property division
  • Support Wills and trusts
  • Estate administration
  • Domestic contracts
  • Settlement negotiations
  • Pensions and life insurance
  • Valuation, and more


Summaries of relevant recent cases are included in a special \"What's New?\" section. Annual index is provided. In the Judgment Photocopy Service, customers can also order the full text of judgments reported in Money & Family Law in digest form. In addition, Best of Money & Family Law is made available.


Having been practicing family law for almost 35 years, Money & Family Law is an invaluable and indispensable part of my family law practice. It is my go-to source for topical and thoughtful discussions of matters related to family law and estates. Money & Family Law has proved its utility countless times in both settlement negotiations as well as contentious matters before the Courts. Indeed, I have had several Family Law Judges opine about how useful and cogent is the information provided in Messrs. Wolfson and Corbin's excellent newsletter. - Cecil J. Lyon, Lawyer, Mediator and Arbitrator, Kanata, Ontario
tr_estore_imagealttag: Image of Money & Family Law

Ontario Statute Citator, R.S.O. 1990 Edition
ec_shortdesc: This annotated service is based on the Revised Statutes of Ontario, 1990 and contains subsequent statutes passed by the legislature. Amendments and digests of cases interpreting specific sections of statutes appear under the applicable Act.
ec_description:
Ontario Statute Citator, Revised Statutes of Ontario (R.S.O.) 1990 Edition is an annotated service, available online in the Ontario Citator Service.

It is based on the R.S.O, 1990 and contains:

  • Table of statutes
  • Table of cases, and
  • Statutes passed by the legislature subsequent to the 1990 revision

This work provides all of the amendments under the title of each amended Act — digests of cases interpreting the specific sections of statutes appear under the applicable Act. Case notes may appear unreported or, when available, carry citations to All-Canada Weekly Summaries with the citation for the full report substituted at a later date. Appeals to case annotations are added as they occur.

The service includes four releases per year containing the text of all the current amending legislations as they are passed. In addition, you receive the Weekly Bulletin Service that is published when the legislature is in session.

The Weekly Bulletin Service consists of:

  • A review of the progress of bills in the previous week
  • An updated cumulative status report and summaries of the Bills before the legislature in the current session
  • A cumulative list of proclamations of Bills passed in previous sessions

The Ontario Statute Citator is included in the Ontario Citator Service on CD-ROM or the internet.
